update.description:
This PR adds the ability to re-harness Valkyrie to any desired pose. Previously, the harness was provided by gazebo's `HarnessPlugin` that has a gazebo topic interface, and the `gazebo_ros_harness` plugin that adds a ros interface. The changes to enable re-harnessing broke the ABI of the `HarnessPlugin`, so I forked them into this repository, while the changes will be sent upstream to gazebo's default branch.

In the VRC, we had an environment variables called `VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED` that needed to be set to `1` in order for teleportation to be used. We should probably do the same for the ros harness attach topic, since it involves teleportation. We will provide an official method for re-harnessing, but we should probably use the gazebo topic interface for that.

Here's a quick example command for sending a re-harness command; feel free to tinker with the pose arguments:

~~~
rostopic pub --once \
  /valkyrie/harness/attach \
  geometry_msgs/Pose \
  '{position: {x: 5.77, y: -1.31, z: 4.5 }, orientation: {w: 1, x: 0, y: 0, z: 0}}'
~~~

I forgot to mention that you have to update the valkyrie urdf in order to use this; change the `libgazebo_ros_harness.so` to `libsrcsim_ros_harness.so`: [available in this gist](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/18c47ae2b0d4e8c2d339df88daa922e9)
update.title: Allow re-harnessing of valkyrie

content.raw: @scpeters, is this ready to be merged?
content.html: @scpeters, is this ready to be merged?

content.raw: I also just fixed a spelling error in 4c6c9e1 and a bad logic mistake in WinchVelocity in 4b150d9
content.html: I also just fixed a spelling error in 4c6c9e1 and a bad logic mistake in WinchVelocity in 4b150d9

content.raw: that's true, but this is already a string in the upstream version of the plugin. also the detach topic is pretty low bandwidth. do you mind if if stays as is?
content.html: that's true, but this is already a string in the upstream version of the plugin. also the detach topic is pretty low bandwidth. do you mind if if stays as is?

content.raw: This is working for me! I have several minor comments which you can choose to address or not. I'll just wait on the clarification on some of them before approving.
content.html: This is working for me! I have several minor comments which you can choose to address or not. I'll just wait on the clarification on some of them before approving.

content.raw: The PID include could go on the cc file
content.html: The PID include could go on the cc file

content.raw: Consider making the topic take a `ConstIntPtr` instead, I believe that's less costly than a string.
content.html: Consider making the topic take a ConstIntPtr instead, I believe that's less costly than a string.

content.raw: We check the index here, should we also check it on `WinchVelocity()`?
content.html: We check the index here, should we also check it on WinchVelocity()?

content.raw:
Missing input params.

Alternatively, I think this could just say that documentation is inherited
content.html:
Missing input params.

Alternatively, I think this could just say that documentation is inherited
